R Notes for Multivariate Analysis Yongfu, Liao 2018-04-04 About This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandocâ€™s Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.name/tinytex/. 0.0.1 ellipse function 0.0.2 Data Generation 0.0.3 Plotting 0.0.4 Generate density f(x) 0.0.4.1 Example: Densities of a Contour 0.0.5 Covariance Matrix
